### Pull out top co-occurence probabilities
```{r}
top.prob <- data.frame(matrix(nrow = nrow(inu.ranks.use), ncol = 11))
for(o in 1:nrow(inu.ranks.use)){
  top <- sort(abs(inu.ranks.use[o,]), decreasing = T)[1:10]
  names <- rownames(as.matrix(top))
  if(length(which(names == "X1")) == 1){
    top <- sort(abs(inu.ranks.use[o,]), decreasing = T)[1:11]
    unclass <- which(names == "X1")
    top <- top[-unclass]
    names <- rownames(as.matrix(top))
  }
  top.prob[o,1] <- rownames(inu.ranks.use)[o]
  top.prob[o, 2:11] <- names
}

top.unique <- list()
for(p in 2:ncol(top.prob)){
  topTax <- as.character(unique(top.prob[p,2:11]))
  top.unique <- as.character(append(top.unique, topTax))
  top.unique <- unique(top.unique)
}
top.unique <- na.omit(top.unique)

prob.use <- data.frame(matrix(nrow = nrow(inu.ranks.use), ncol = length(top.unique)))
rownames(prob.use) <- rownames(inu.ranks.use)
colnames(prob.use) <- top.unique
for(q in 1:length(top.unique)){
  match <- which(colnames(inu.ranks.use) == top.unique[q])
  prob.use[,q] <- as.numeric(inu.ranks.use[,match])
}



### Make phyloseq object
```

### Plot co-occurrence probability heatmap
```{r}
prob.hm <- plot_heatmap(prob.phy, sample.order = c("Acetate", "Butyrate", "Propionate", "Lactate", "Fructose", "Glucose", "Mannose", "Phenylalanine", "Glutamate", "Uracil"), taxa.label = "ta10") +
  geom_tile(colour="gray40") +
```

```{r}
# How many components to use?

  # Selected first 67 to test because they don't have NA's

  # Component 1
  # Not much of an elbow
plot(pca.metab)

# Assess clustering of samples
```
